title: Overview of duke
code: plot <- ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, aes(x=bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm)) +   geom_point(aes(color = body_mass_g)) +   labs(title = "Bill Length vs. Bill Depth", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Depth (mm)")  plot +    scale_duke_continuous() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). plot +    geom_point(shape = species) +   scale_duke_continuous() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). #> Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). plot +    scale_duke_continuous() +   theme_minimal() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

title: Overview of duke
code: plot1 <- ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, aes(x=bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +   geom_point(size =3) +   labs(title = "Bill Length vs. Bill Depth", caption = "(Colors used) \n Duke Royal Blue, Eno, Copper", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Depth (mm)")   #guides(fill=guide_legend(title="New Legend Title"))     ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, aes(x=bill_length_mm, y = bill_depth_mm)) +   geom_point(aes(color = species)) +   labs(title = "Bill Length vs. Bill Depth", subtitle = "This is the subtitle", caption = "All text is in Duke Royal Blue", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Bill Depth (mm)") +   facet_wrap(~species) +   theme_duke() +   scale_duke_color_discrete() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3` plot1 +    theme_duke() +   scale_duke_color_discrete() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #>  #> New names: plot1 +    scale_duke_color_discrete() +   theme_minimal() #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3`

code: plot2 <- ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, aes(x=species, fill = species)) +   geom_bar() +   labs(title = "Distribution of Penguin Species", caption = "(Colors from left to right) \n Duke Royal Blue, Duke Navy Blue, Copper", x = "Species", y = "Count")  m_penguins <- penguins %>%   dplyr::filter(sex == "male")  plot2.1 <- ggplot(m_penguins, aes(x = sex, fill = sex)) +   geom_bar()    plot2 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. plot2.1 +   scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. # 8-category plot plot2.2 <- ggplot(dumby_df, aes(x = Grade, fill = Grade)) +    geom_bar()  plot2.2 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. # 7-category plot plot2.3 <- dumby_df %>%   slice(-13) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Grade, fill = Grade)) +    geom_bar()  plot2.3 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. # 6-category plot plot2.4 <- dumby_df %>%   slice(-c(9, 10, 13)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Grade, fill = Grade)) +    geom_bar()  plot2.4 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. # 5-category plot plot2.4 <- dumby_df %>%   slice(-c(9, 10, 13, 7, 18)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Grade, fill = Grade)) +    geom_bar()  plot2.4 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. # 4-category plot plot2.5 <- dumby_df %>%   slice(-c(9, 10, 13, 7, 18, 4, 8)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Grade, fill = Grade)) +    geom_bar()  plot2.5 +    scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption.

text: ## Jitter Plot - Discrete Color
code: plot6 <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(year, body_mass_g)) +   ggplot2::geom_jitter(ggplot2::aes(color = species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Year", x = "Year", y = "Body Mass (g)")  plot6 +    scale_duke_color_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3` plot6 +    scale_duke_color_discrete() +   theme_minimal() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3` plot6.1 <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(year, body_mass_g)) +   ggplot2::geom_jitter(ggplot2::aes(color = bill_length_mm)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Year", x = "Year", y = "Body Mass (g)")  plot6.1 +    scale_duke_continuous() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`). plot6.1 +    scale_duke_continuous() +   theme_minimal() #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

code: plot7 <- ggplot(data = palmerpenguins::penguins) +   ggmosaic::geom_mosaic(aes(x=ggmosaic::product(sex, island), fill = sex)) +   labs(title = "Penguin Sex vs. Island", x = "Island", y = "Penguin Sex", caption = "(Color from top to bottom) \n Granite, Duke Navy Blue, Duke Royal Blue")  plot7 +   scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: `unite_()` was deprecated in tidyr 1.2.0. #> ℹ Please use `unite()` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the ggmosaic package. #>   Please report the issue at <https://github.com/haleyjeppson/ggmosaic>. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. plot7 +   scale_duke_fill_discrete() +   theme_minimal()

code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(species)) +   ggplot2::geom_bar(ggplot2::aes(fill = species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Species Count", caption = "There are three different species of penguins.", x = "Species", y = "Count")  plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption.

title: theme_duke()
code: ## if one variable, do we want fill to be duke blue ## have scale_color that would give custom colors to different dists. plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(body_mass_g)) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(fill = species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Distribution of Penguin Body Mass", caption = "There are three different species of penguins.", x = "Body Mass (g)", y = "Count")  plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_bin()`).

title: theme_duke()
code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(sex, body_mass_g)) +   ggplot2::geom_boxplot() +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Sex", x = "Sex", y = "Body Mass (g)")  plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_boxplot()`).

title: theme_duke()
code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(bill_depth_mm)) +   ggplot2::geom_density() +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Density of Penguin Bill Depth", x = "Bill Depth (mm)", y = "Densiy")  plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density()`).

code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(year, body_mass_g)) +   ggplot2::geom_jitter() +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Year", x = "Year", y = "Body Mass (g)")  plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font for caption. #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aidan Gildea. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gildea (2023). duke: Makes color blind friendly visualizations Duke's official colors. https://github.com/aidangildea/duke, https://aidangildea.github.io/duke/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {duke: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors},   author = {Aidan Gildea},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/aidangildea/duke, https://aidangildea.github.io/duke/}, }

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: duke allows users generate visualizations Duke’s official suite colors color blind friendly way. using alongside ggplot2, can easily promote accessibility Duke community beyond.

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
code: # Install duke directly: install.packages("duke")  # Or alternatively, install development version from GitHub # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("aidangildea/duke")

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: package fully integrated ggplot2, therefore, allows customize several visualization features. Aesthetic functions theme_duke() scale_color_duke() quickly make graphs visually pleasing accessible audience. information use ggplot2, please visit GitHub repository.

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: First, create standard ggplot2 visualization. example, use scatter plot.  , simply convert visualization Duke official colors calling theme_duke() scale_duke_discrete.
code: library(ggplot2) library(duke)  plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(colour = Species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "Title", caption = "Caption", x = "X Var", y = "Y Var")  plot plot +    theme_duke() +   scale_duke_discrete() #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3`

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: questions package use, please reach Aidan Gildea aidan.gildea@duke.edu.

title: Duke Palette Function — duke_pal
text: Duke Palette Function

title: Duke Palette Function — duke_pal
code: duke_pal()

title: Duke Palette Function — duke_pal
text: Character vector Duke palette hex codes.

title: Duke Palette Function — duke_pal
code: duke_pal() #> function (n)  #> { #>     n_values <- length(values) #>     if (n > n_values) { #>         warning("This manual palette can handle a maximum of ",  #>             n_values, " values. You have supplied ", n, ".",  #>             call. = FALSE) #>     } #>     unname(values[seq_len(n)]) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x5642b2218f28> #> <environment: 0x5642b22185c0> #> attr(,"max_n") #> [1] 8

title:
Apply discrete color scale
Partial code for this function can be attributed to ggthemes. — scale_duke_color_discrete
code: #' # Default example plot3 <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x=Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width, color = Species)) + ggplot2::geom_point() plot3 + scale_duke_color_discrete() #> New names: #> • `colour` -> `colour...1` #> • `colour` -> `colour...3`

title: Apply continuous color scale — scale_duke_continuous
text: Apply continuous color scale

title: Apply continuous color scale — scale_duke_continuous
code: scale_duke_continuous(   ...,   low = "#00539B",   high = "#E2E6ED",   space = "Lab",   na.value = "#666666",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = c("colour", "color", "fill") )

title: Apply continuous color scale — scale_duke_continuous
text: ... Arguments passed continuous_scale. low Low end color gradient. high High end color gradient. space Color space calculate gradient. na.value Color used NA values. guide Type legend. "colorbar" continuous scale, "legend" discrete scale. aesthetics String vector strings detailing aesthetic features continuous scale can apply .

title: Apply continuous color scale — scale_duke_continuous
text: visualization continuous duke color scale

title: Apply continuous color scale — scale_duke_continuous
code: # Default example from Hatteras to Duke Royal Blue plot3 <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x=Petal.Length, y = Petal.Width)) +   ggplot2::geom_point() plot3 + scale_duke_continuous()

code: #' # Default example plot3 <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(x=Species, fill = Species)) + ggplot2::geom_bar() plot3 + scale_duke_fill_discrete()

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
text: base_size base size base_family base family base_line_size baseline size base_rect_size base rect

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
text: plot Duke colors

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(cars, ggplot2::aes(speed, dist)) + ggplot2::geom_point() + ggplot2::labs(title = "Duke Blue") plot + theme_duke() #> Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. #> Warning: Defaulting to sans font for title. #> Warning: Defaulting to sans font for legend. #> Warning: Defaulting to sans font for axis. #> Warning: Defaulting to sans font for caption.
